articles.title: House: Senate killed P200 wage hike bill
articles.description: The promise of passing a historic measure to raise the long-stagnant wages of workers was quashed anew.
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines — The promise of passing a historic measure to raise the long-stagnant wages of workers was quashed anew after the 19th Congress adjourned without a reconciled version from both the Senate and House of Representatives.

articles.title: Philconsa: Senate act can endanger PH democracy
articles.description: The Senate’s decision to “return” the impeachment case against Vice President Sara Duterte to the House may constitute grave abuse of discretion.
articles.content: The Senate’s decision to “return” the impeachment complaint against Vice President Sara Duterte to the House of Representatives may constitute grave abuse of discretion, according to the country’s oldest constitution watchdog, warning that any circum... [7018 chars]

articles.title: Police revise death toll of Air India crash to more than 240, with dozens more casualties suspected
articles.description: Sole survivor, a British-Indian man, described scene of devastation after plane crashed into building
articles.content:
Police in the western Indian city of Ahmedabad said more than 240 people were killed on Thursday when an Air India plane bound for London with 242 people on board crashed on to a medical college hostel, revising an earlier death toll.
A British-India... [4656 chars]

articles.title: Air India crash survivor jumped out of emergency exit, walked down the street
articles.description: Social media footage showed a man in a bloodstained white T-shirt and dark pants limping along a road and being helped by a medic.
articles.content:
New Delhi: Ramesh Viswashkumar, the only known survivor out of the 242 people onboard an Air India plane that crashed in Ahmedabad, had been sitting near an emergency exit on the London-bound flight and managed to jump out, police said.

articles.title: Bangsamoro adds unique hue in Independence Day observance
articles.description: The BARMM added its hue to the colorful national tapestry that was on display during the country's observance of the 127th Independence Day on Thursday.

articles.title: Monster black hole jet from the early universe is basking in the 'afterglow' of the Big Bang
articles.description: NASA's Chandra X-ray Observatory has captured a striking image of a distant quasar from the "cosmic noon," including a giant energy jet "being illuminated by the leftover glow from the Big Bang itself."
articles.content:
An illustration of a black hole blasting out a surprisingly powerful energy jet in the distant universe, as seen in a new study from NASA’s Chandra X-ray Observatory.

articles.title: Labor's productivity hopes need a bold program, not another roundtable
articles.description: Let's never knock a summit, but let's not be taken in by the suggestion that the planned August meeting, involving employers, unions and the government, will mark some breakthrough moment.
articles.content:
Former prime minister Paul Keating famously used to say the resident galah in any pet shop was talking about micro-economic policy. These days, if you encounter a pet shop with a galah, she'll be chattering about productivity.
Productivity is current... [7407 chars]

articles.title: Supernova Explosions Changed Earth's Climate and Shaped Humanity's History
articles.description: Most scientists agree that supernova explosions have affected Earth's climate, though the details are not all clear. They likely cooled the climate several times in the last several thousand years, just as humanity was becoming established around the world. The evidence is in telescopes and tree rings.
